comment: He is honestly a great professor I had him for algebra and pre calc and got an A in both. He keeps giving extra credit even when most don't deserve it. Definitely take him.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Honestly he was one of the best math professors I had in a while. Considering I wasn't too fond of math, I'm pretty surprised I mostly understood and was able to keep up. You do have to put in the work but honestly, if you pay attention in class and actively work on the things he go over, you'll be fine

If you a looking for a great math professor, I definetely recommend taking his lecture!! Took him for college algebra and precalc and passed! He explains the materials well and exams are fairly easy. TAKE HIM!!

Good professor and I would take him again, however, attend every single lecture and be attentive during them or you will fall behind. One of the only things I did not like about him was he is exstremely fast passed going through the notes and that can be very annoying when learning new material that is difficult.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Good teacher, you'll be good if you pay attention and don't procrastinate, but he's very rude, he'll make you feel stupid for asking questions so it discouraged me from asking anything most times. I once asked a question I couldn't find the answer to and it was on an announcement in d2l and his response was "Was that too much for you to read?" ..

A bit of a pessimist and doesn't always receive questions well, but he grades fairly, lectures clearly, and aside from the moments when he doesn't receive questions kindly, he'll assist you pretty well. Do the homework and definitely have notes to take. Attendance is mandatory! Study guides are extra credit. Had him fro precalc, would take again!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Xia is so far the best Math professor I've ever had. His grades are clear and as long as you show up and do the homework, it'll be the easiest math class you'll ever take.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Good professor, albeit he is fast paced. He has an accent, but it didn't interfere with my comprehension of his material at all since he's that good at teaching! As someone who has a history of being terrible at math, I've been able to get all A's on his algebra tests so far thanks to completing the study guides. Homework is all online via ALEKS.

If you can be silent, be silent. Getting a question wrong for guessing or trying during class? He will tell you that you're going to fail the test. Always finds ways to take points off and doesn't actually answer any of the questions that people ask and states it the same way that wasn't understood. Extremely fast-paced class, just take online.

He has an accent, but it's not as bad when you get used to it. Aside from attendance, what he covers in class are almost always on ALEKS, so I would strongly suggest attending class. Also, do the study guides because they help tremendously, trust me.

I was scared to take college algebra after all I've heard. Take it from someone who has almost failed geometry and has never gotten an A in math, it's easy if you do the Aleks and study guides. Lectures are boring, but important to attend for your grade. He truly does care about his students. You will hate Aleks, but you will be thankful in the end

I think professor Xia is a great professor when it comes to how he approaches his lectures. Though he is fast paced he is always asking for questions which people don't ask any. He always talks about going to the math lab which is the biggest cheat codes for math especially if you're confused. If you actually sit down and do the work he's great.

Yan Xia is a good professor imo, for math1111. His material is confusing to understand at first because of how fast he goes through notes and he gets sidetracked alot but after a while you will be fine. He always talks about precalc though. There is a lot and I mean a lot of ALEKS homework. DO THE STUDY GUIDE BEFORE THE TEST. He also has an accent.

Being an 8 am math class, the whole class was very uninterested. For me, it took me a very long time to be able to understand him. The homework can take a very long time, so don't procrastinate. Also, do the study guides because it is almost exactly what you'll be seeing on the test.
He is a nice guy but his accent is hard to understand.

Nice guy. Hard to understand at times, but Aleks makes it very easy to learn things you miss. Study guides are very similar to test, so do them as many times as you can. If you do the homework and practice tests, you'll probably end with an A. PS, no notecard for tests. (Math 1113)

Professor Xia is a funny sarcastic prof. However, he can move fast through lectures and assigns alot of homework. It would be comparative to AP level math, but he takes the time to look for questions, and provides an extension if he is delayed on teaching. Tests are important, attendance is graded, gives some extra credit. Lecture heavy. 9/10 Class

He is not horrible, but it can be hard to understand him at times. Also, all of the homework is on ALEKS and is due every week. He does give a note card and extra credit on some tests. He starts taking attendance very early, so be there at least 10-15 minutes early. If you can find another professor I would take them instead.

why y'all hating, this professor is honestly a very helpful and easy to understand, yeah he might an accent but that does not impede his great teaching capacity. he provides extra credit for tests that could easily bump your grade to a higher letter grade. Attendance is mandatory and Aleks is really relevant, but i would highly recommend him.
His accent was so strong so it made it really hard to understand. You mainly learn through the ALEKS assignments.
Do not take his class! He is not helpful at all! Just a warning if you want to enjoy life at least a little bit!!

In his class there are lots of ALEKs assignments. Do them weekly and don't forget to do the corrections after taking the knowledge check. His tests are in person and range from 12 to 20 questions except for the final. Random quiz grades that are easy. He has an accent but you'll get used to it. Do all these thing and you will be fine.

He was an amazing professor for my algebra class. All of the homework was on ALEKS. His lectures were good. If you follow his lectures, take notes, do the study guides to get extra points added to your tests, and show up to class then I guarantee you that this class will be easy. His quizzes were also pretty easy.

Professor Xia is an amazing teacher. A lot of his work is based off of Aleks so that makes the homework super easy. When teaching he makes sure to be very thorough, but he is fast paced. He is super kind and loves to share stories! Would definitely take his class again.

He is an exceptional math prof who helps make it easy. Lectures are well-structured. Tells stories :) Encourages class participation and provides extra resources. His class can be fast paced, so be prepared to keep up. Very helpful to students, especially ones who asked questions. He allows notecards on tests. I think quizzes, too; can't remember.

He is a good professor. He gives a lot of extra credit, has a study guide open for each test and drops some of your lowest homework grades and participation grades. Attendance/Participation grades taken every week. ALOT of Aleks homework. Aleks is really what I learned from the most. He had lecture slides for every class that you can take notes on.

Very knowledgeable and seems to enjoy teaching. There are weekly attendance quizzes and homework assignments are simple as long at you take good notes. You get to have a 3x5 notecard for every test including the final. HIGHLY recommend taking notes on an ipad so you can write directly on the lecture slides he goes over in class.
The professor is very sweet and the course was not too difficult. There were only 4 tests and he gave extra points on tests for completing the study guides. Attedance is mandatory though.

He is a very good professor at math, he genuinely cares about his students. If you need help, he will help you. He teaches is very helpful and a lot better than most of the professors here. If you're in Algebra then you need a TI-30XIIS Scientific Calculator, if you have an ti-84 then you would take the tests without a calculator.

I have never been good at math but Professor Xia's class was super straightforward. You have Aleks homework every week but it should only take you 30 minutes. He creates study guides that are exactly like the tests so you know what to expect. Tests are in person but you are allowed to bring an index card of notes to help you. He is super nice!
He has a bit of a strong accent which can make understanding him a little hard sometimes but he is more than eager to clarify if you ask.  Great class
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Had Professor Xia for Precalculus. If you make a genuine attempt to participate in the lecture and do the homework, he definitely notices your effort. You can tell that he wants you to do well in the course. Very generous with extra credit and is generally thorough in his explanations. Great instructor.

Honestly the greatest math teacher I've had so far. Has short but effective guided notes to follow along with lectures, and easy to complete study guides that are a good representation of whats on the test. He does an incredible job of helping students understand the material, and is incredibly passionate for the job.
This class was hard plus he had a strong accent, making it extremely hard to understand him. Everything was on Aleks but all the tests were in person. I would not recommend this class

Took him for a freshman pre-req course (math 1111) and while algebra isn't that hard anyway he did a great job as being one of my first profs and helped me adjust to college. Most of the homework is on ALEKS. Gives a lot of extra credit assignments (not that you'll need them) but I would definitely take him again. Truly cares about his students.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Best teacher ever! Had him last year, and thought he was mean but he was just getting us to focus and he warms up eventually! best math teacher ive ever had, great guy. funny, sweet, gives great advice, tough work and he cares about all of his students! very motivating and wonderful!

Very cool, would take breaks to educate us on a few of his life experiences, and give pretty god explanations to people who didn't get the topic. During the last few weeks with him, we did brain puzzles and they were super fun. Apply yourself and you'll get good grades.
Best teacher ever
I would take him again, He is so nice. He's strict when you act up, but if you behave its a free A.
He's the best teacher
He is my favorite teacher
W teacher.
He is Him.
He is very nice, He was cold at the beginning but became friendlier towards the end, his lectures are understandable and i learned a lot from this math class.
Would always ask what we wanted to be when grown up and explained how to use the math we learned. Extremely sigma teacher, very inspiring.
gigga chad of a teacher, I had him a year ago and he is the best math professor I've ever had.
HE IS THE BEST!

He was really hard to understand and his class was super tough. He expected everyone to know the math even though it might have been a long time since we have taken that math. I would not recommend taking his class.

Nice and cares about students. Lots of homework that can be tricky so manage time well. Gives lots of bonus points on tests and grades them fairly. Funny and sometimes gives life lessons for students. Attendance is mandatory and measured by in class quizzes, can't be made up. One hw extension and drops 2 lowest quizzes. Wants students to succeed.

This class was hard and his teaching made it worse. You can barely understand what he is saying and it's worse because he talks and goes so fast. Every assignment was on ALEKS and all the test was in person. you could use one notecard on the test tho which can help sometimes

Great math teacher
a meh homeroom teacher (i didn't have him for homeroom but my friend did in 6th grade)
he's chill, gets his point across. at the beginning of the year, i disliked him but he became friendlier by the end. cool dude, very smart.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: I had him last year, he was very tough. Not the nicest. Notes were a requirement. Homework was fair. But at the end of the year, I learned everything I needed to know. Reflecting back, he was a great teacher.
